troubleshooting: Check network connectivity to database server
Verify database server is running and accepting connections
Increase connection timeout value in configuration
Check firewall settings and port accessibility
Verify username and password are correct
Check user account status and permissions
Ensure database user exists in the system catalog
Check authentication method configuration

E_US0921.description: Table or view does not exist
troubleshooting: Verify table/view name spelling and case sensitivity
Check if table exists in the correct database/schema
Ensure proper permissions to access the object
Verify the object hasn't been dropped or renamed
Review transaction logic for proper locking order
Minimize transaction duration and scope
Consider using explicit lock hints if needed
Implement retry logic for deadlock scenarios
common_causes: Concurrent transactions accessing resources in different orders

troubleshooting: Free up disk space on database server
Check disk usage on all database file locations
Consider moving files to different drives
Implement database file size monitoring
common_causes: Database files growing beyond available space
Log files consuming excessive disk space
Temporary files not being cleaned up

troubleshooting: Increase lock timeout value if appropriate
Optimize queries to reduce lock duration
Review transaction isolation levels
Identify and resolve blocking processes
common_causes: Inefficient queries holding locks too long
